intro: Cnemidostachys patula f. dubia, commonly known as the slender spikegrass, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the grass family Poaceae and is characterized by its slender, upright growth habit. The plant produces small, spike-like inflorescences that are typically greenish or yellowish in color. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
